sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: 12 more hostages and 30 Palestinian prisoners are exchanged as the temporary truce between Israel and Hamas is extended.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Finland says it will close the last of its eight border crossings with Russia on Wednesday over migrant concerns and an unusual surge in arrivals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The European Court of Justice gives the green light to public offices across the EU to ban religious symbols from the workplace in a, quote, general and indiscriminate manner.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of Palestinians lined the streets of Ramallah late Tuesday to welcome 30 Palestinian prisoners freed by Israel in the latest swap with hostages in Hamas captivity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: to swap with hostages in Hamas captivity. This was the fifth day of the temporary truce between Israel and Hamas after a 48-hour extension was agreed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The military wing of Hamas, Al Qassam Brigades, posted a video late on Tuesday, this time showing crowds in Rafah, greeting a convoy of vans arriving at the meeting point where the militants handed 12 hostages to the Red Cross.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There were marked celebrations among Israelis gathered in Sderot who cheered as the vehicles transporting the released hostages arrived.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Hamas and other militants still hold about 160 hostages out of 240 seized in their October 7th assault on southern Israel that ignited the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A spokesman for the Israeli government has said it would be open to an additional five days of truce under the current hostage-prisoner exchange agreement. During the pause in fighting, the UN World Food Programme is delivering desperately needed food to more than 120,000 people in Gaza, but has reiterated that the supplies it was able to provide were woefully inadequate to address the level of hunger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of thousands that are facing an immediate risk of starvation. WFP hopes for the extension of this pause, which offered a window of relief that could pave the way for a longer-term calm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Safe and impeded humanitarian access cannot stop now. While there does appear to be a willingness to extend the truce, which is due to end after one more captive exchange on Wednesday night, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the fighting will resume with full force.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: with full force. A change of tone in the NATO Secretary General's statements on Ukraine ahead of a meeting of

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: the alliance's foreign affairs ministers started a conversation behind closed doors in Brussels about what a possible end to the war could look like.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Some analysts think that Jens Stoltenberg is slightly removed from the way he has been in the past, where he's always talked about defending Ukraine for as long as it takes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: JENS STOLTENBERG, National Security Council Member, I was left wondering, why did he say that Ukraine had already recaptured 50 percent of its territory?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And I was thinking to myself, well, is this a sign that maybe NATO is thinking about the future of Ukraine?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Despite official reassurances of continued support for Ukraine, the EU is struggling to keep its word amid disappointment over Ukraine's summer counteroffensive and with the West's attention shifting to the Israel-Hamas war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Although no European leader would say it officially, there is a growing feeling that the war in Ukraine won't end any time soon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Is this putting pressure on Kiev to start negotiations?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Not according to the EU's foreign affairs chief, Joseph Bure, who met with Ukraine's minister for foreign affairs on Wednesday in Brussels, both of whom denied any pressure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's Minister for Foreign Affairs on Wednesday in Brussels, both of whom denied any pressure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: VLADIMIR PUTIN, Ukrainian Foreign Minister to Ukraine's Minister for Foreign Affairs on Wednesday, April 15, 2020 I don't see any sign of members having what you call fatigue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Everybody is concerned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Everybody recognizes the successes of the Ukrainians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And I am sure the member states will continue supporting Ukraine because it is an existential issue for us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We cannot afford to get tired.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: According to some experts, the real problem is that Russian President Vladimir Putin seems to be in no hurry to even think of the word negotiations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: seems to be in no hurry to even think of the word negotiations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And at this stage, it would be extremely difficult for Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to enter into negotiations, especially if this would impact the territorial sovereignty of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I think some European countries would accept the exchange of land for peace. This is very complicated, highly political, highly emotional. But President Zelensky himself would be the person who would have to make this decision. But it's a kind of treacherous decision as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: NATO support could play an important role for the future of the conflict the possibility of Ukraine becoming a member of the Alliance could also be critical the big freeze on movement between Finland and Russia

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: continues Helsinki is about to close its last remaining border crossing along its shared 1,300-kilometre frontier due to a surge in migrant arrivals, predominantly from the Middle East and Africa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Petteri Orpo has accused Moscow of undermining his country's national security and trying to create a migrant crisis after Finland joined NATO earlier this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In April, the Kremlin warned it could be forced to take quote countermeasures in response to the Nordic countries' accession to the US-led alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The headquarters of the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe, ahead of a joint announcement from the Baltic nations that their foreign ministers will boycott the next two-day OSCE meeting in North Macedonia because their Russian counterpart Sergei Lavrov says he is attending.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Baltic officials say Lavrov's visit risks legitimizing Moscow's offensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It will be Lavrov's first visit to a NATO country since Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's foreign minister, Dmytro Kuleba, also says he will not be attending.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Police truck drivers continue to block the border crossings with Ukraine over what they see as unfair competition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The EU scrapped entry permit requirements for Ukraine to support its war effort against Russia. Police truck drivers now want these requirements to be reinstated. For Ukrainian truck drivers, the three-week-long blockade has not been easy. The procedure that used to take 10-15 hours now takes a week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: That is, it is also not easy to assess this, because the conditions are not human.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian sources claim that contrary to what was promised earlier, essential goods such as humanitarian aid are being blocked at the border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian officials said Polish demands are unrealistic, with some claiming a pro-Russian sentiment among Polish truckers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Despite the war still raging on, the EU and Ukrainian government are starting preparations

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: for the post-war reconstruction of the embattled country, with the aim of rebuilding it better and greener once the fighting is over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: European Commission, Ukrainian government and businesses all gathered in Vilnius on Tuesday to discuss the necessary preparations, saying that once the war ends, reconstruction plans must already be in place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The war started by Russia has had devastating effects on nature in the country, for example, the destruction of the Kharkov water dam, which resulted in the worst human-made ecocide since the Chernobyl nuclear plant incident in 1987.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We have a unique opportunity to build back better and greener.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So when we talk about cities that were destroyed we talk about the sustainable planning of those cities integrating the most recent knowledge. I'm very pleased to see so many architects across Europe who are actually devoting their time. When we talk about public buildings, which massively were destroyed, hospitals, schools, kindergartens, they all will have to be energy efficient.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They all will have to be powered with the renewable energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine currently has the most landmines in any European country, and around 34 animal species have disappeared due to the fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The country's forests have also suffered serious losses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But the biggest challenge is not only restoring nature, but also to have a climate-neutral economy after the war finishes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: For this, Ukraine needs to transform its energy network and rebuild public and residential buildings in an energy-efficient way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The reconstruction of the country is a tempting opportunity for many European countries who've already signaled their interest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Representatives of the building industry as well as water and waste management companies also took part in the discussions in Vilnius.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We are not talking about just about international support like a direct support to restore something. No, we are talking about some investments and first of all we need to cooperation with investors to build new facilities, to build new technologies, to build new maybe industries but using best available technologies in a European way like in European legislation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: According to the European Commission, the reconstruction of Ukraine will have a massive cost, and Russia must pay for it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Another challenge will be to convince the 6 million Ukrainians currently living in Europe to move home and contribute to the rebuilding efforts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Any public office across the European Union now has permission to ban employees from wearing religious garments or symbols in the workspace. That's according to the EU's Court of Justice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The announcement came after a Labour court in Belgium banned aqué une femme de porter un escarfe en office. Le port visible sur le lieu du travail de tous signes révélant notamment des convictions philosophiques ou religieuses peut être justifié par la volonté de la dite administration d'instaurer, compte tenu du contexte qui est le sien, un environnement administratif totalement neutre. Lainar stressed that each member state has a right to determine what a neutral environment looks like.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While previous rulings by the top court determined that such bans infringed on religious freedoms, this time it stressed the need for quote equal treatment for all in employment and occupation.
